page.title: 07BINGHAM MARKET
page.content: The market is held every Thursday with the stalls set up around the Buttercross which is in the centre of the square of Bingham.On average 50 or so traders attend each week and a minimum rent of Â£5 is paid to the Rushcliffe Borough Council for each stall. The market attracts hundreds of people from Bingham and the outlying villages. There is a great variety of goods to be bought and the shopkeepers of Bingham welcome the trade it also attracts for them. Although it is only a small market compared to those of Nottingham, Newark and Grantham, it is always busy and special buses are put into service on Thursdays for the convenience of all.
